column20: Police Shootings Source Data Link(s) *Methodological Note: A police shootings "incident" can involve more than one person being shot. As such, cases where a department shot more than one person in the same incident were counted as a single incident for the purpose of analysis.)

https://www.muckrock.com/foi/fort-worth-330/police-shootings-data-fort-worth-police-department-71429/#file-782397 ; Fort Worth Police chief stated that there were 9 police shootings in 2019: https://www.star-telegram.com/news/local/fort-worth/article238919203.html

column21: Since Jacksonville did not report data to the FBI UCR program, arrest totals were obtained for Duval County (Jacksonville is a city-county consolidated government policed by the Jacksonville Sheriff's Office) via the Florida Department of Law Enforcement: https://www.fdle.state.fl.us/FSAC/Data-Statistics/UCR-Arrest-Data.aspx

column20: http://assets.lapdonline.org/assets/pdf/2016-use-of-force-year-end-review-small.pdf ; http://www.lapdonline.org/use_of_force/content_basic_view/65012 (11 of the 36 incidents were critical incidents that were not shootings)

https://www1.nyc.gov/site/nypd/stats/reports-analysis/use-of-force.page (adversarial conflict shootings only); 22 adversarial shootings from 1/1/19-10/24/19: https://www.wsj.com/articles/nypd-officers-fire-weapons-more-often-in-2019-with-more-injuries-and-deaths-11573491180 ; two additional NYPD shootings found through keyword search ("New York police shooting", "Officer-involved shooting", etc.): https://nypost.com/2019/12/14/nypd-shoots-man-who-pointed-fake-gun-at-them-in-bronx/ and https://www.ny1.com/nyc/all-boroughs/news/2019/10/25/brownsville-brooklyn-shooting-nypd-officers-injured-nyc
column21: Since NYPD did not report arrests data to the FBI UCR, individualized arrest data for the NYPD was obtained via data.gov : https://catalog.data.gov/dataset/nypd-arrests-data-historic

Since Portland Police Bureau did not report 2013 arrest data to the FBI UCR, the Portland Police Bureau Annual Report was used for 2013 data (Arrest Totals for All Part 1 and Part 2 Offenses used in analysis since UCR Data includes all Part 1 and Part 2 Offenses): https://www.portlandoregon.gov/police/article/518831 ; FBI UCR: https://crime-data-explorer.fr.cloud.gov/explorer/national/united-states/arrest

Since MDPD did not report arrest data to the FBI UCR, MDPD Annual Reports were used: https://mpdc.dc.gov/sites/default/files/dc/sites/mpdc/publication/attachments/MPD%20Annual%20Report%202018_lowres.pdf ; https://mpdc.dc.gov/sites/default/files/dc/sites/mpdc/publication/attachments/MPD%20Annual%20Report%202016_lowres.pdf ; https://mpdc.dc.gov/sites/default/files/dc/sites/mpdc/publication/attachments/MPD%20Annual%20Report%202014_lowres_0.pdf

column1: Average Shootings (For the 23 Cities with 2013-2019 Data Available)
